plugins.name: Pixelate
plugins.description:
üé® Draw, design, and play‚Äîone pixel at a time.


Pixelate is a free simple tool where you can paint, customize colors, and export your pixel creations effortlessly. Whether you‚Äôre sketching a retro-style pixel art, patterns, or just having fun, I hope pixelate makes it easy to bring your ideas to life!


How it works,


Double-click any color to customize üé®, use the Brush or the Paint Bucket to fill areas ü™£, and click Save to export your drawing üíæ.


Some thoughts,


  1. Change grid sizes to match your creative vision.
  2. Reset your drawing using the Clear button or by adjusting the grid size.
  3. Select and edit pixels directly in Figma to fine-tune your design.
  4. Build in smaller chunks to create intricate, large-scale masterpieces.


If you run into any glitches, let me know! I'm always open to feedback and feature ideas. üöÄ
plugins.tagline: üé® Draw, design, and play with Pixels‚Äîone at a time.

plugins.name: My ICO of Joy
plugins.description:
An always-free plugin inspired by Mike LaJoie ‚Äî a seasoned icon design professional and hence the similar sounding name of the plugin ‚Äî to streamline the process of creating and exporting Windows icons directly from Figma.


‚ú® Features

  1. Lossless compression to achieve extremely small file sizes!
  2. An optional pro template you can use to design your icon for all common frame sizes that make up a well-designed icon. For example, this allows you to really "push those pixels" at the small frame sizes like 16√ó16.
  3. Export any frame(s) as icons ‚Äî even non-standard sizes.
  4. A responsive plugin UI that updates in real-time as you select the groups and frames you wish to export. No need to reload the plugin.


üìñ Instructions

  1. Select layers in Figma (layers in the same frame/group are exported as a single icon)
  2. Click on the Save ICO button
  3. Choose a save location from the Save As dialog (the default save location is your "Download" folder)


Note: If you want to optimize your workflow even more, name the group/frame layer to be the name of the icon.

accepted.name: Jeremy Knudsen
accepted.description: Visual Systems Designer at Microsoft

plugins.tagline: A simple way to create and export Windows icons directly from Figma

Apply tags to one or multiple frames

Filter tagged frames

Auto delete tag on frame remove

Live tag position based on frame position

Tags will move with frames if the plugin is open.

plugins.name: Nicolas Cage Image Replacer
plugins.description:
Nicolas Cage Image Replacer is an easy way to bring one of the most meme-actors into your Figma file. It's also could be a fun way to prank colleagues üòÉ


üçΩ How to use

Run the plugin. Click on the "Cage on the page!" button ‚Äî the plugin will take all frames or shapes with the image fill and add an additional Nicolas Cage image on the top.


‚öôÔ∏è How it works

  • The plugin don't replace the existing image, but add an additional image fill to the layer on the top.
  • You can remove all Cage images by just one button.
  • You can remove all Cage images even if you closed the plugin. All images with hash IDs will be associated with the plugin until you delete them. Hash IDs will be created for each page where you run the plugin.


üì∫ Youtube Demo

üïπ GitHub Repo

accepted.name: Pavel Laptev
accepted.description: Hi! My name is Pavel Laptev. I'm a digital designer. Love design, frontend, art and architecture. Make things work, write articles, believe in opensource.

plugins.name: OxyScan
plugins.description:
Introduction

OxyScan is a powerful tool designed to allow users to scan a Figma page and provide an overall Design System compliance score and flag non-compliant layers.


We can then access those layers in 1 click and update them to make them compliant. This tool enables designers to perform a quick and easy check of their file before handing it over to the developers,


Installation

To install the OxyScan Plugin, follow these steps:

  1. Open Figma
  2. Go to the ‚ÄúPlugins‚Äù menu.
  3. Search for OxyScan
  4. Click the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button next to the plugin‚Äôs name.


User Guide

OxyScan is based on a naming convention. In order to be able to compute a Design System Compliance score you must follow this nomenclature and prefix each component according to their type.

  • Design System Components: üí†
  • Modules Components: üß©
  • Helper Components: üß∞


Differences between DS components, Modules and Helpers

  • Design System are the atomic part of your design system
  • Modules are more complex organisms that are including business logic. They are composed of DS components, here to fasten the Product Designers workflow.
  • Helpers are components regularly used by Product Designers that don't require to enter in the DS, such as OS mobile keyboards, mouse cursors...


Run a Scan

Follow this steps to perform a analyse on your Figma page

  1. On your Figma page, click on the Ressources Menu, then Plugins
  2. Select OxyScan plugin
  3. The analysis will run automatically and the results displayed right after.


How is the compliance calculated?

Oxyscan is scanning each layer one by one.

If the scanner if finding:

  • a layer with üí† as prefix, +1 is added to DS compliant
  • a layer with üß© as prefix, +1 is added to Modules
  • a layer with üß∞ as prefix, the layer is ignored
  • a hidden layer, the layer is ignored
  • a visible layer without prefixed icon and without children layer, +1 is added to not compliant
  • a visible layer without prefixed icon with children layer, the layer is ignored and the scan goes the children layer.
  • a font with declared Font style and Color (from Styles or Variables), +1 is added to DS compliant
  • a font with one element customised, +1 is added to non-DS compliant


All Figma feature are skipped:

  • Figjam arrows
  • Frames, Groups, Auto-layouts, Sections

 

Support

If you need further assistance, you can reach out to us by using this mail: matthieu.vignolle@doctolib.com
plugins.tagline: Design System compliance scanner

plugins.name: Bannericot Banners Builder
plugins.description:
Introducing Bannericot: Effortlessly Create Stunning HTML Banners with Figma Integration.


Check out Quick Overview Video (2 min)


Unlock the true potential of your Figma designs with Bannericot, the ultimate plugin for building professional HTML banners. Seamlessly import your Figma creatives into our intuitive interface and watch your designs come to life as professional banners without coding like never before.


Documentation and Video Tutorials

For documentation and video tutorials please visit https://bannericot.com/


Features

  1. Banner: Each Figma frame is a banner. Import frames into the plugin to work with.
  2. Animation: Configure animations for each layer in the banner. All such settings are stored in a Figma file to preserve the settings.
  3. Versions: Create variants of dynamic parts of a banner (e.g. different Call To Action buttons, texts, hero images). The plugin can generate versions of the banner by using all the combinations of such variants.
  4. Export to HTML: Any frame and all its components can be exported into HTML (CSS, GSAP animation).
  5. Export to MP4: seamlessly render HTML banners into MP4 videos directly within the plugin. Add audio track to your banner.
  6. Index: Review all exported banners on 1 page including variants and customize this page to delight your customer during review and approval.
  7. Minify: HTML and CSS can be minified.
  8. Reduce Package Size: Set the k-weight of exported zip archive of the package to reduce the size.


Packages

  1. Free plan - gives you 5 exports (daily)
  2. Pro or Team plan - allowing you to get the number of exports you need (shared across your team). Contact us via e-mail to get a custom plan.


Support

We keep working on improving our product and would love to hear from you.

You can reach out to us via e-mail.
plugins.tagline: Animate > Export > Sign-Off

plugins.name: Spreadsheet to Charts - Easy, No Fuss, Word Cloud
plugins.description:
Spreadsheet to Charts helps you generate Bar Charts, Pie Charts and Wordclouds based on rows and columns on a spreadsheet survey (.xlsx or .xls from Google Sheets or Excel).


With this tool, you can:

  1. Automatically generate charts from spreadsheet.
  2. Select from 3 types of charts. (Bar, Pie, Wordcloud)
  3. Edit those generated charts as Shapes and Texts.


Spreadsheet to Charts is meant to help Designers and Product Managers quickly generate charts needed for research data visualisation, to even preparing research pitches.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Locate .xlsx or .xls file on plugin.
  3. Choose type of chart.
  4. Check conditions (labels, axis, legends)
  5. Generate Charts.


by Yuan Jie

accepted.name: Yuan Jie
accepted.description:
Product Designer/Developer

Making simple tools to help designers design more efficiently. In particular, tools to help visualise big amount of data.

plugins.tagline: Easily make Charts and Wordcloud from Spreadsheet Data.

plugins.name: Resonote - Summarize and Analyze Feedback
plugins.description:
About the plugin

This plugin allows you to select any design feedback left on a Figma or FigJam file and uses AI to summarize it, provide suggestions, analyze actionability of feedback or it's sentiment. It's perfect to use with a feedback template that can live inside a Figma design file.


Instructions

  1. In your Figma or FigJam design file locate all the feedback notes - for optimal experience I would recommend using a feedback template.
  2. Next, select all layers that contain feedback and click on one of the actions - summary, suggestions, analysis or sentiment.
  3. Wait for up to 10 seconds for the output to appear, it sometimes can take longer depending on the amount of text selected.
  4. That's it! Hopefully this saves you time sifting through a mountain of feedback you just received.


Resources

Figma feedback template for optimal experience:

https://www.figma.com/community/file/1214896263485881279/Feedback-template


Note

Plugin is currently in beta stage, would be great to hear any suggestion on how to improve it in the comments. Anything is possible!
plugins.tagline: Summarize and analyze your design feedback using AI

Value Wizard is the essential Figma plugin for quick design-to-dev value conversions. Effortlessly convert frames into rem, android scalable dp, px, cm, and mm. Enjoy live value updates and an intuitive UI for a seamless experience. Perfect for web, mobile, and print design.

  2. Intuitive UI for seamless usability

  5. Suitable for web, mobile, and print design

plugins.name: Figlet
plugins.description:
Figlet is a sandbox-like environment with a built-in editor that allows you to play with and learn how to use the Figma developer platform right inside Figma.


Important: This plugin requires you to create a Figlet account so it can save your data and preferences to the cloud.


Features


  1. Create figlets: small code examples using the Figma developer APIs
  2. Play with Figma APIs inside an editor (see limitations below)
  3. Follow interactive tutorials that teach you about the developer platform
  4. Browse community published figlets and publish your own
  5. Star your favourite figlets so you can check them out later


Editor


You can play with the Figma developer platform and its APIs using Figlet's editor. When you create a new figlet you're shown an editor and a new "code.js" file is created.


Running code

To run code, press the "play" icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the plugin window, or press Cmd/Ctrl + Enter.


To improve the editor experience, the editor positions the viewport on the newly created nodes. When you re-run your code, these nodes are removed from the canvas. This wouldn't happen in the real world. You can disable these in the settings section.


Showing a UI window

You can show a UI window by adding a UI file to your figlet and calling it using figma.showUI(__html__) inside the "code.js" file. To add a UI file, click on the dropdown with the folder icon above the editor, and select "ui.html +".


Profile


When you publish your figlets to the community, your name appears next to your figlet. You can set your name in the settings section.


Settings


Editor

  1. Center viewport on run: Viewport is centered on any nodes created by the code
  2. Remove nodes on re-run: Any nodes created are removed before the code is run again
  3. Show toolbar in UI window: A toolbar is shown in the UI window when figma.showUI() is used


Plugin

  1. Remember window state: Remember the last page that was open when closing and re-opening the plugin



Limitations


Because of the nature of Figlet being a plugin, there are some limitations that restrict you from using certain features. These include but may not be limited to:


  1. figma.widget
  2. figma.fileKey
  3. figma.parameters
  4. figma.codegen
  5. figma.teamLibrary (not available yet)
  6. figma.payments (disabled for now)
  7. figma.textreview, figma.on('textreview'...) (disabled for now)


These limitations however do not prevent you from writing and sharing code that contains these methods.


Privacy Policy


When you create a Figlet account, some of your personal information is collected for the purpose of using the plugin. An account is needed so that your data can be backed up and you can share your content with the community.


Only your email address, full name, your avatar and any figlets you create are collected. Your data is never shared with anyone else and is only used for the purpose of managing your account and sharing figlets with other Figlet users.


Your data is stored for as long you have a Figlet account.

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Play with the Figma developer platform, follow interactive tutorials and share code examples

plugins.name: Json Exporter
plugins.description:
Exports figma data as a single json document with as much as possible of the internal figma data left as-is. The purpose of this plugin is act as a data dump for further processing externally.


The code is open source and is available on github, where you can also find more details on the exported data structure: https://github.com/kasper573/figma-plugin-raw-json-exporter.


If you are using Typescript, you may also be interested in https://github.com/kasper573/figma-to-typescript, which uses the json exported from this plugin to generate a Typescript representation of your design tokens.

accepted.description: Coding since '99. Fan of UX, FP, architecture and tooling.

plugins.name: Level Access Figma plugin
plugins.description:
Effortlessly layer accessibility into your designs with the Level Access Figma plugin 

As a designer, you know what‚Äôs best for your users, including those who rely on assistive technologies to access your experiences. While accessibility is a necessity in design, it can often come with challenges. Challenges like knowing how to find issues to fix, understanding how to fix them, or learning how to avoid them in the future.


This is why we at Level Access developed our Figma plugin. This plugin is one of several design-oriented tools created by designers, for designers, with the goal of helping you effortlessly layer accessibility into your designs without creating new manual work.


How does it work?

In short, choose an element in your design that you‚Äôd like to test, select it, and review your results!


Our plugin works by helping you check for common accessibility issues in the core building blocks of your design‚Äîthings like buttons, links, text input fields, and checkboxes. Once you select an element you‚Äôd like to check, identify the element within the plugin, and review your results instantly. 


What if I‚Äôm new to accessibility? How will I know what to check for or what to fix? 

When incorporating accessibility into design, you should be able to find and fix any issues in your design quickly, so you can continue your core design work without interruption.


This is why every time you scan an element in your design, we reveal every accessibility consideration for that element, from color contrast and typography to target sizes and labels. If there is an issue, we identify what needs to be changed, and let you apply that change with the push of a button.


Whether you‚Äôre new to accessibility or a seasoned veteran, you can quickly run comprehensive tests, find issues, and fix them in a few short steps.


How can I learn more about accessibility in design? 

Our Figma plugin is just one tool in our solution that helps designers learn about and create accessible experiences. Design tools from Level Access also include: 

  • Tailored, role-based learning paths created specifically for designers to help you build your knowledge and skills in accessible design. 
  • Comprehensive Design Evaluations that enable you or your team to submit designs and design systems for review by our expert testing team. Plus, results are delivered in annotated reports with specific recommendations for different designer roles. 
  • Access to subject matter expertise, including our design industry experts and our seasoned testing teams. 
  • Unlimited support hours to help you answer questions, work through problems, and unstick roadblocks. 


How do I get started? 

If you‚Äôre already a Level Access customer with an account, send a note to our support team at support@levelaccess.com for more information on how to get started!


If you are a Level Access customer and don‚Äôt have an account, reach out to your organization admin or Level Access Customer Success Manager to get started.


If you would like to become a customer, book a demo our with team to learn more.


About Level Access 

Level Access empowers organizations with the advanced software, expert managed services, and training needed to create accessible, compliant digital experiences. Learn more at: levelaccess.com

plugins.name: Mental Health & Cognition Plugin
plugins.description:
About this plugin


Products impact how we feel, think, and behave. This plugin aims to help all product makers design inclusively for a range of mental health & cognitive needs. It‚Äôs our responsibility to consider the impact our designs can have. Use the evidence-based guidance in this plugin to design mindfully and advocate for inclusive design choices.


With insights from published research, focus groups, expert review, and co-creation sessions, we have identified principles key to designing for mental health and cognition. Consider how you can preserve attention and motivation, direct action and energy, and customize experiences to increase belonging and agency.


Using the plugin


  1. Consider what common patterns are present in your design
  2. Explore evidence-based guidance for each pattern to identify top stressors and suggestions
  3. Empathize with customers through direct quotes
  4. Drag guidance and customer voice onto your canvas to help you modify your design and defend inclusive design decisions
  5. Work with your team to embed wellbeing in your designs, share the plugin broadly, and contribute to the inclusion revolution!


The basics of designing with mental health and cognition in mind


  1. Inclusive design demands collaboration with the people you seek to serve. Co-creation with customers who have permanent mental health and cognition needs will create value for customers who have temporary or situational needs.
  2. Usable design is inclusive design. When people can‚Äôt use technology, they tend to blame themselves, aggravating emotional and mental health needs. Prioritize usability.
  3. Reduce the cognitive demands of your design by breaking down large tasks or information into smaller chunks and helping customers to manage distractions, initiate and complete tasks, and remember steps or information.
  4. Celebrate success to preserve motivation through positive emotions and enhance flow.
  5. Use more than just engagement metrics to measure success. Embed opportunities to learn how users feel. Over-reliance on MAU and DAU can encourage design choices that deteriorate a customer‚Äôs experience.



Learn more about the plugin, the research that informed it, and accessibility best practices


Check out Microsoft‚Äôs guidebook and case studies for Cognition and for Mental Health. Leverage tenets and traps and universal design principles to further ensure great usability. To learn more about accessibility for the web visit w3.org.


This plugin is brought to you by Microsoft

84035.name: Mental Health & Cognition Plugin
84035.description:
About this plugin


Products impact how we feel, think, and behave. This plugin aims to help all product makers design inclusively for a range of mental health & cognitive needs. It‚Äôs our responsibility to consider the impact our designs can have. Use the evidence-based guidance in this plugin to design mindfully and advocate for inclusive design choices.


With insights from published research, focus groups, expert review, and co-creation sessions, we have identified principles key to designing for mental health and cognition. Consider how you can preserve attention and motivation, direct action and energy, and customize experiences to increase belonging and agency.


Using the plugin


  1. Consider what common patterns are present in your design
  2. Explore evidence-based guidance for each pattern to identify top stressors and suggestions
  3. Empathize with customers through direct quotes
  4. Drag guidance and customer voice onto your canvas to help you modify your design and defend inclusive design decisions
  5. Work with your team to embed wellbeing in your designs, share the plugin broadly, and contribute to the inclusion revolution!


The basics of designing with mental health and cognition in mind


  1. Inclusive design demands collaboration with the people you seek to serve. Co-creation with customers who have permanent mental health and cognition needs will create value for customers who have temporary or situational needs.
  2. Usable design is inclusive design. When people can‚Äôt use technology, they tend to blame themselves, aggravating emotional and mental health needs. Prioritize usability.
  3. Reduce the cognitive demands of your design by breaking down large tasks or information into smaller chunks and helping customers to manage distractions, initiate and complete tasks, and remember steps or information.
  4. Celebrate success to preserve motivation through positive emotions and enhance flow.
  5. Use more than just engagement metrics to measure success. Embed opportunities to learn how users feel. Over-reliance on MAU and DAU can encourage design choices that deteriorate a customer‚Äôs experience.



Learn more about the plugin, the research that informed it, and accessibility best practices


Check out Microsoft‚Äôs guidebook and case studies for Cognition and for Mental Health. Leverage tenets and traps and universal design principles to further ensure great usability. To learn more about accessibility for the web visit w3.org.


This plugin is brought to you by Microsoft


Special thanks to Kelly Gorr, Ali Benter, Amanda Poh, Will Brennan, Amanda Yang, Tany Holzworth, Karina Dion, Ben Truelove, Tasha Lutfi, Christa Keizer, Hernan Maestre, Alice Lee, Bradley Stastny, Brandon Foy
84035.tagline: In context guidance for designing inclusively

plugins.name: PalettePal
plugins.description:
Palette Pal is a plugin that allows you to keep all your favorite colors in one place.

How It Works
===========
Running the plugin will display a window where you can add, remove, and edit colors.

Simply edit the color by either editing the hex value or by opening up the color picker.

You can click on the color box to copy the hex value to your clipboard. Or you can save it to your browser's cache by clicking the lock button.

Additional Features
==============
* Drag to reorder
* Add/Remove colors
* Edit the color of the background to see how well a color works atop another
* Set the difference between the colors

plugins.name: Navigate Multiple Siblings
plugins.description:
Use the plugin to navigate multiple selected siblings. Best use is with component instances.


How to use:

  1. Select multiple (same) instances.
  2. Press Enter key to enter the instance.
  3. Use plugin to move through siblings.


See video explainer.


Create keybindings (macOS only):

  1. Go to Keyboard > Shortcuts tab
  2. Select "App Shortcuts" on the left pane
  3. Add (+) Figma from "Application" dropdown
  4. Upward ‚Äî under "Menu Title" write Upward and add your custom keybinding in "Keyboard Shortcuts"
  5. Downward ‚Äî under "Menu Title" write Downward and add your custom keybinding in "Keyboard Shortcuts"
  6. Restart Figma and try it out ;)


‚Äî

plugins.name: Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
Styles to Variables is a Figma plugin designed to empower design system creators. It seamlessly converts your existing local styles into Figma's robust design tokens, known as "Variables." This automation simplifies the management and organization of your Figma projects, making your design workflow more dynamic and efficient.


How to Use


  1. Run the Plugin: Start the plugin to begin the conversion process.
  2. Choose Collection: You have the option to select an existing variable collection or create a new one. If you choose an existing collection, you can also specify a mode.
  3. Specify Mode: If you're using an existing collection, you can either update an existing mode or create a new one. Simply type the mode name; the plugin will automatically detect if it should update or create.
  4. Execute: Click the "Convert" button to start the conversion. The plugin will convert local styles into variables and place them in the specified collection and mode.
  5. Review: After the conversion is complete, review the variable collection and modes to ensure they meet your requirements.


Core Features


  • Local Style Conversion: Automatically converts all local styles into Figma Variables.
  • Collection Management: Choose to add variables to an existing collection or create a new one.
  • Preservation: Maintains the original names, color values and descriptions of your local styles during conversion.


Key Benefits


  • Efficiency: Streamline your design process by automating the conversion of local styles to variables.
  • Flexibility: Choose between adding to an existing collection or creating a new one, giving you more control over your design tokens.
  • Integrity: The plugin preserves the original names and values, ensuring a smooth transition to a token-based system.
  • User-Friendly: With its intuitive UI and straightforward options, the plugin is accessible for users of all skill levels.

accepted.description: UX Designer @ Hoffmann Group

plugins.name: Theme Buddy for Ant Design
plugins.description:
Theme Buddy for Ant Design

Theme Buddy for Ant Design is a Figma plugin that simplifies working with Ant Design themes. It has an export feature that lets you save Figma theme settings as JSON files, making it easy for developers to ensure their code matches Figma designs. It also has an import feature that allows you to apply theme settings from your code directly into Figma.


Learn more


Requirements

  1. Must have the Ant Design System for Figma version 5.11 or newer.
  2. Compatible only with Ant Design System for Figma and AntBlocks UI, not with other UI kits.
  3. JSON output is usable in the React version of Ant Design (5.0+).


How to use it?

Read the documentation here.

accepted.name: Matt Wierzbicki
accepted.description: Product designer and entrepreneur running multiple projects.

plugins.name: Plot Pilot
plugins.description:
Select a Graph Type and start filling in the inputs in the table.


HOW IT WORKS:

Note: Do not delete the auto inserted frame before closing the plugin, or press cancel and it will be deleted itself.


For Bar, Scatter and Rectilinear/Curved Graphs, fill at least two rows to see Plot Pilot in action.

Input rows can be appended with the '++' button in each Graph type.


Rectilinear and Curved Graphs: Enter values for X and Y Axis. Give the axes a label (optional). The axes scales are determined automatically and the numbers can be turned off. Select the Curve checkbox to enable handles to play with Bezier curves for each of the points.


Scatter Plot: Just like Rectilinear/Curved Graphs, enter just the data required in the table and you will experience the magic of graph creation.


Bar Graph: The input table has two fields, Frequency and Bar Label. Enter the Bar heights in Frequency while the latter field is optional. Just like the other graphs, the scale is automatically determined based on inputs.


Pie Charts: Enter values in decimals for each row. For example: 0.15, 0.15, 0.2, 0.5 would create a complete Pie chart.
plugins.tagline: Beyond bars & pies. Captivate with Plot Pilot's interactive curves. Chart magic, made simple.
